title: Why is Evelynn's ultimate cool down so long?
body: I kind of want to know. She deals damage to multiple enemies, yes, but it at most deals 25 to 30% of the enemies HP also slowing them and gives her just 300 shield for a couple of seconds. I just want to know why it takes over 80 seconds to cool down. (I think thats with CD reductions I'd had but I don't know.) Evelynn doesn't have much, and that's her only real burst, can we lower it to about 70 or at most 65 by max level?

I can't say off the top of my head that I know exactly why that ultimate has the cooldown that it does (since I believe it's been quite some time since we've ever changed it), but my gut reaction is that it actually makes quite a bit of sense, especially at earlier ranks.

Because Eve has the advantage of being able to go pretty much anywhere on the map undetected at pretty much any time, having that really strong, reliable slow on a much shorter cooldown could be really crazy and make her chain ganking case pretty damn scary.

Do you guys generally think it should be on a shorter cooldown? Does it feel too long to succeed as Eve? What does reducing its cooldown enable that you couldn't already do and that you should be able to or need to do?

The cooldown is just a big part of the ultimate feeling so unsatisfying as a whole. While a character like Eve should never have a gamechanging ultimate, when you have what is already a mediocre ultimate on an early game cooldown reserved for the truly insane ults like Paranoia, it makes the character feel so unfairly treated.

I absolutely understand the necessity for Evelynn to have a long cooldown on her early game ultimates because her ganks are so difficult to prevent and her passive as a whole provides a LOT of early game power, but Agony's Embrace honestly is weak to the point that it's a relatively poor power spike for her ganks when it IS up. A very moderate nuke that falls off hard if the gank victims are at all far away from full health with a mediocre slow and a shield that in a ganking scenario is essentially useless is just... honestly not threatening. And when you add in how little she can use it, it's just so bizarre. Quite frankly her ganks pre-6 are more threatening than her post-6 ganks, but there's no barrier to her chain ganking at that point of the game, yet when people hit 6 (and generally get better at peeling off ganks), Evelynn has a random gate (the giant ult cooldown) that means she can only keep up with the power of the laners once every three minutes. That feels very off and doesn't really address her power curve in the right way IMO.

It's one of the big parts of her kit that makes me think she needs a rework. I've never heard of a single person who thought it was a powerful or fun ultimate to use.

I don't know about others, but I rarely use her ultimate for the slow.  I use it for damage and to shield myself to stay alive, roughly equally.  If I really need to kill someone fast without them killing me, I use the ultimate to hurt them and to protect myself from just being blown up if they fight back, or I use it on a group of enemies to get a strong enough shield to survive fighting near them.

The only time I use the ultimate for a slow is when someone is really set on running away from me and I can't manage to catch up to them with my W, and I usually don't like doing that because it feels like a waste of its power (I used by ultimate merely as a slow and so I am much less effective in combat / duels for a long time afterwards.)

(Note that this is AP assassin Eve.)

I've been playing Evelynn for years (Look at my profile and know that I am not lying) and the above quoted is the excuse for almost literally everysingle nerf Evelynn has ever received. It has no value as an explanation given that you could destroy her entire kit and give the same speech practically verbatim for that as well.

>Do you guys generally think it should be on a shorter cooldown? Does it feel too long to succeed as Eve? What does reducing its cooldown enable that you couldn't already do and that you should be able to or need to do?

1- Yes. Look at Lee's kit and ultra short cooldowns it has in addition to Lee being manaless. And before you say "BUT EVELYNN IS INVISIBLE!" she is not invisible, she can only bypass green wards, not stalk people like Twitch and Shaco... Lee can also easily bypass green wards through his multiple low cooldown manaless dashes. Also look at the raw power that Lee's ultimate has, as an AoE stun, single target stun and single target snare with huge AD scaling along with shorter cooldown than Evelynn's ultimate. Where the balancing point here? either Evelynn needs buffs or Lee Sin needs nerfs.

2- No, I can succeed with Evelynn even with an ultra high cooldown on the ultimate, but only through great effort which is not as required with other champions.

3- The ability to assassinate or otherwise engage in a team fight without being massively crippled if another engage occurs swiftly after that one. Basically it is a matter of decision making where either decision is bad because of the long cooldown. Again, it has one of the longest cooldowns for the level of power it has. 

The cooldown for Evelynn's ult has been nerfed before and it was just as , unjustified during those instances. I understand that the post I'm responding to is 5 months old but the point is just as valid.

Evelynn takes nerfs over and over with the argument always being "BUT SHES INVIS!!!", how about you take that same level of "SMASH FIRST, NEVER ASK QUESTIONS" to Lee  , Zed, Yasuo , Thresh or Riven?

OKAY. So. I've been playing A TON of Eve this past week. She's probably my new favorite champ. Rumble's Rumble, but.. Idk. Anyway. I've been thinking about this a lot, and loving Eve as much as I do i think that the CD on her ult is reasonable to an extent. With attack/move speed in her kit and the ability to proc sheen/rylai's endlessly with her low Q cooldown I think that it makes sense to have her ult on a high cooldown. I'm not a great jungler so I lane with her top/mid mostly. But I can figure out that a skilled jungler with this ult on a low cooldown would be a monster. Like stupid monster. Like Eve perma banned monster. So personally, I think Eve is already competitively viable, there are just better options for junglers, who would be the ones using her in pro games. But if you guys over at Rito would like to see her played on the LCS level I would say a SLIGHTLY lower ultimate cooldown would be best. I'll leave it to you guys to decide how much lower that would be. I think the rest of her kit is fine where it is, so leave that shit alone :p

Thanks guys for the great champ =]

150 is a bit much for an ult like that but it dramatically drops as you get into the game, much more than other ults.
